ygData.subject: Rukus
ygData.msgSnippet: ooC: Well, things have settled down enough for me to have time to rejoin the RPG for a while, probably the summer, but whatever, i ll enjoy it while it lasts.

ooC: 

Well, things have settled down enough for me to have time to rejoin 
the RPG for a while, probably the summer, but whatever, i'll enjoy 
it while it lasts. ^^

biC:

In the far reaches of the universe - well, it's pretty hard to say 
HOW far with the universe in question - a military weapons 
developement space station of the Autobot-Decepticon alliance, named 
Berthyscape, was working on a new weapons tech. Their scientists had 
recently started experimenting on harnasing the power of a small 
black-hole.

As with most things, not fully understanding what you are doing can 
often prove fatal. The Scientsts, proved this when one of the black-
holes they were working on began to rupture it's containment field. 
A code red alert was initialized, and evac began immediately. It was 
soon realized, however, that there would be no escape from this 
phenomenon by simply trying to leave the area. So, in an attempt to 
save all of their lives, the head scientist initiated another 
project that had also been worked on at the time: the time-warp rift 
device. At the moment, they could only figure out how to open it up, 
not how to pinpoint target locations. Things that went in were never 
returned, and the time readings that were sent back were all 
different from the space station time. Due to these problems, 
research on the time-warp rift tech was not high proirity.

The head scientists enabled the device, and opened up the time-warp 
rift in the space station. The black-hole, the escape pods, and the 
station itself were all sucked in. Although they hadn't discovered 
this yet, objects which enter a time-warp rift without some sort 
method of normalizing the time fluctuations, would end up spat out 
at random times and in random locations. Following this principle, 
all of the pods, the station, and the black-hole were then spit out 
at various times and places.

One pod found it's way to a planet, which (though the bot inside the 
pod didn't know it) happened to be inhabited. His onboard computer 
listed the planet as unknown, with similarities to an ancient planet 
which destroyed itself, Terra, or more commonly known as Earth to 
it's weak but self-destructive beings which inhabited it originally.

His pod splashed into the upper atmosphere and streaked across the 
sky leaving a tell tale - not that he knew this - sign of a new pod 
entering the the brewing conflict between various forces of 
transformers which had already found themselves stuck on this 
archaic planet.
